description: Biology terms and definitions for Chapter 1

questions.question: A part of the earth that consists of life. (i.e. most regions of land, bodies of water like lakes, oceans, and rivers, and the surrounding atmosphere)
The community of living things in an area, along with the nonliving features of the environment that support the living community.
Individual living things. (ex. a squirrel, grass, sea cucumber, etc.)
Life's basic units of structure and function.
Units of inherited information along the length of DNA molecules.
Organisms whose entire bodies consist of one single cell.
The broadest category of classification. There are three domains: Archaea, Bacteria, and Eukarya.
They contain nuclei that separates DNA from the rest of the cell.
Organisms that are made up of many cells.
The process by which plants make food.
How many days are in a week?
How many planets are in the solar system?
How many oceans are there in the world?
Who was the first man on the moon?
Who was the second man on the moon?
